intro: Polygonum ampliusculum, commonly known as redstem filaree, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a low-growing annual herb that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features slender, reddish stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and along streambanks.
